page.title: 16The Gayton May Day Festival
page.content: The May Day is an anual event run by the local Women's Institute (W.I.) catering mainly for children. All children living in the village aged between 5 and 11 years are eligible for the position of Queen, Attendant or Page Boy. Villagers meet and parade to the village green where the new Queen is crowned. Children give posies to all the watching ladies. Then there is a display of Maypole dancing and Morris dancing given by the children of Gayton Junior School. After this there are some fun races such as the 3-legged and the slow bicycle race and a floral arrangement competition with a special theme. Finally the W.I. provide all the children with a packed tea. It is a lovely village day totally uncomercialized and relatively peaceful but a fun day enjoyed by everyone.
